pizzaProgram.gui.EventHandlers
Class CookGUI_CookViewEventHandler

java.lang.Object
  pizzaProgram.gui.EventHandlers.ComponentEventHandler
      pizzaProgram.gui.EventHandlers.CookGUI_CookViewEventHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, EventListener
public class CookGUI_CookViewEventHandler
extends ComponentEventHandler
implements ActionListener

Handles all events generated by user interaction with the Cook GUI view.

Author:
IT1901 Group 3, Fall 2011

          A reference to the main Cook GUI module

          Registers all appropiate event handlers at the different components in the cook view
 
Method Summary
 void actionPerformed(ActionEvent event)
          Handles events from the Cook view, and calls the appropiate event handling function
private  void addEventListeners()
          Registers event listeners at the various components in the cook GUI that this class handles
private  void enableOrderMarkButtons(Order order)
          Enables/disables the "mark order in progress" and "Mark order completed" buttons in the cook GUI according to the state of the passed Order instance
private  String generateExtrasStringFromExtrasList(ArrayList<Extra> extrasList)
          Generates a single string from a list of Extra instances that represents that list of extras
private  void handleOrderSelection(ListSelectionEvent event)
          Handles the event of a user selecting an order in the order list
protected  void handleSearchBoxSelection()
          Automatically selects all text in the order search text box if the user gives it focus.
private  void markOrderAsInProgress()
          Marks the currently selected order as in progress
private  void markOrderCompleted()
          Marks the currently selected order as completed
private  void resetUI()
          Resets the UI to its initial state
private  void searchOrdersBySearchBoxQuery()
          Searches the database for orders by the text written in the order search box, then updates vthe order list
private  void showAllOrders()
          Shows all orders that have not yet finished cooking (which it fetches from the database)
private  void showOrder(Order order)
          Shows an order in the cook GUI
 void showOrdersBasedOnSearchBoxContents()
          Shows all customers in the cook gui if the search box is empty, otherwise it searches for the contents of the search box in the database
private  void updateCurrentOrder()
          Updates the current order by doing a refresh with the database.

updateCurrentOrder

private void updateCurrentOrder()
Updates the current order by doing a refresh with the database. It will refresh by the contents of the order search box; it will search again when there is text written in the search box, or refresh all orders if it is empty

searchOrdersBySearchBoxQuery

private void searchOrdersBySearchBoxQuery()
Searches the database for orders by the text written in the order search box, then updates vthe order list
